job_description: Embedded Software Engineer - job post Troxel Aerospace Industries, Inc. Austin, TX $85,000 - $185,000 a year -  Full-time, Part-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $85,000 - $185,000 a year Job Type Full-time Part-time Contract Company Overview Founded in 2015, Troxel Aerospace Industries, Inc., (Troxel Aerospace) is the world leader in radiation testing and development of fault-tolerant software solutions for satellites. We are an employee-owned company comprised of a small team of engineers who design and environmentally test aerospace and high reliability systems by leveraging decades of experience to deliver successful solutions to civil, defense, and commercial programs. Description Associates in this position lead and contribute code to teams that develop embedded software to support our products and radiation testing of aerospace processor systems. Positions Currently hiring up to two associates at either the junior or senior level, possibilities for full-time salary or part-time contract work. Essential Functions · Develop new software and expand existing software per project requirements in a process-oriented software development environment for embedded, resource-constrained systems · Work with software requirements and architecture, prototyping, design, implementation, integration, test, documentation and delivery of software · Demonstrate familiarity with various processor, memory, I/O architectures, multi-core systems, and heterogeneous systems · Demonstrate a fluent understanding of compiled languages, scripting languages, assembly, and machine code · Work with conventional operating systems (e.g., Linux), real-time operating systems (e.g., VxWorks), and hypervisors for multi-core processors, and their associated host/development environments and tools · Follow industry and company best practices for developing software that emphasizes correctness, modularity, portability, comprehensibility, and proper error handling · Develop test code to validate modules and their integration to the larger system through regression testing · Demonstrate excellent communication ability, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface with all levels of associates, customers, and suppliers including supporting bid and proposal efforts · Thrive in lab and radiation test facility environments and be able to collaborate closely with system engineers, hardware designers, and integration/test engineers · Lead development teams while also providing substantial contributions to all stages of the development process · Thrive in a self-managed work environment with high expectations, significantly diverse assignments, collaborative/team settings across all levels Minimum Qualifications · Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering and at least 5 years of software engineering industry experience post-graduation · Experience with embedded software development using C, C++, and Python and version control software on multicore processors · Experience using POSIX shell and utilities, multi-threading and inter-process communication synchronization, Linux kernel internals and use such as partitioning and mounting devices, networking stack, init systems, process management, serial consoles, and SSH, FTP, TFTP, and DHCP · Ability to obtain and maintain an active in-scope TS/SCI clearance Preferred Qualifications · Master’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering and at least 10 years of directly applicable software engineering industry experience post-graduation · The minimum qualifications and knowledgeable in fault tolerant system design, high assurance software, flight critical software, embedded systems, hardware/software interfacing and drivers, concurrency and parallel programming, distributed systems, GPU programming with OpenCL and Cuda on AMD and NVIDIA GPUs, compiler internals, and hypervisors · Currently holds an active in-scope TS/SCI clearance Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract Pay: $85,000.00 - $185,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Application Question(s): Are you a U.S. Citizen? Experience: Embedded software: 2 years (Required) Distributed systems: 1 year (Required) Work Location: In person Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Oracle Agile PLM Analyst Developer - job post Assa Abloy 723 reviews Austin, TX Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Oracle Agile PLM Analyst Developer An Amazing Career Opportunity for an Oracle Agile PLM Analyst Developer! Location: Austin, TX (Hybrid); Eden Prairie, MN (Hybrid); Fort Lauderdale, FL (Hybrid) Job ID: 18030 Are you talented PLM Analyst and excited to analyze, develop and maintain our PLM platform? If so, we want to hear from you! Who are we? HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely. We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4500 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo HID’s Corporate Group: Oracle Agile PLM application is core for HID to manage all its product life cycle and is part of the global enterprise applications suite. HID is a mature user of the Oracle Agile Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) application using PLM for Item master management, contract manufacturing integration, change orders and global documentation repository. The HID IT team partners with the HID change management team on daily operations, enhancements and major projects for our PLM application. The successful Oracle Agile PLM Analyst Developer will be part of the HID IT team and responsible for analyzing, designing, developing and maintaining our PLM platform. The Oracle Agile PLM Analyst Developer will keep abreast of merging trends and functionality that supports the business to adopt change at pace. As our Oracle Agile PLM Analyst Developer , you’ll support HID’s success by: Providing support for system issues to determine whether the issue is with people, process, or technology. Engaging with Product Data Governance and Data Quality processes Providing support to end users by able to triage reported business problems and coordinate with IT teams Explaining technical issues and IT solution strategies to stakeholders and other shared technical teams Performing business process modelling, user experience modeling and basic technical architecture diagramming Exercising independent judgment and discretion in solving business problems Interfacing on a day-to-day basis with other analysts, business users, super users, and IT team members to support business operations and follow change management Following up with Oracle on Support requests, bugs, Patches through closure Developing test plans to assure that developed solution satisfies client requirements including but not limited to developing test scripts, setting up test data, and assisting with activities relating to unit testing, performance, integration, data conversion, cut-over testing, documentation, and training HID has adopted the SAFe methodology for project deliverables. Actively participate in quarterly IT PI (Program Increment) planning What we will love about your background: 5 -7 years of experience in Oracle AgilePLM 9x solution specifically in Product Collaboration (PC) and Product Portfolio Management (PPM) Design and configuration knowledge of item masters within Oracle Inventory, Oracle PIM, and Oracle Bill of Materials (BOM) modules Solid Knowledge of AgilePLM configuration, Criteria, Roles, User Groups, Privileges and Administration. Deep understanding of Customization (AgilePLM SDK, PX development, Web Services, ACS, ACP, Events). Strong Knowledge in Java/Groovy Scripting. Very strong in Java to create custom solutions. Understanding of AgilePLM integration with Oracle EBS or other downstream systems. Working exposure to modules such as Oracle Product Hub (PDH) / Product Information Manager (PIM) in Oracle EBS 12.2.X or higher Ability to work with minimum supervision in a multi-cultural and multi-geographical environment. Understanding of MDM data governance policies and processes, data sources, be-spoke systems, data security, user responsibilities, approval groups and roles Experience with performing detailed system analysis in partnership with technical team using the provided business requirements Your Experience and Education include: BS in Information Systems, CS or related field plus a minimum 5-7 years’ working experience with Oracle AgilePLM required PMP/PMI/CSM (scrum master) certification will be a plus with exposure to Scaled Agile Framework (SAFE) methodology Who you are as a Team Member: Ability to effectively communicate in the English language, both verbally and in writing. Ability to read and interpret technical journals, specifications, international technical standards, etc. Ability to interact and influence variety of users and management. Why ? Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to . Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers. Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted. This opportunity may be open to flexible working arrangements. HID is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation. Application due 2023-05-10 Function IT, Telecom & Internet Experience level Mid-senior level Location Austin, Texas, United States Eden Prairie, Minnesota, United States Fort Lauderdale, Florida, United States
